title: Members severally liable for debts where business carried on with fewer than
content: 32. If at any time the number of members of a company is reduced, in the case of a public company, below seven, and it carries on business for more than six months while the number is so reduced, every person who is a member of the company during the time that it so carries on business after those six months and is cognizant of the fact that it is carrying on business with fewer than seven members, shall be severally liable for the payment of the whole debts of the company contracted during that time, and may be severally sued therefore. Contracts, etc. Form of contracts.
